The source and origin of the claim: The experts would have examined the source of the claim, including the person or organization making the claim and their credibility. They would have looked into whether the claim originated from a reliable and trustworthy source.
Evidence and supporting documentation: The experts would have analyzed the evidence and supporting documentation provided to back up the claim. This could include any documents, videos, or other forms of evidence that were presented as proof of the claim.
Expert analysis and opinions: The experts would have sought out opinions and analysis from other experts in the field to verify the authenticity of the claim. They would have looked for consensus among experts and evaluated the qualifications and expertise of those providing opinions.
Corroboration with other sources: The experts would have cross-referenced the claim with other sources and information to determine if there was corroboration. They would have looked for consistency and agreement among multiple sources to validate the claim.
